awd_titl_txt: SGER:  Regulation of Gene Expression in the Bacillus cereus Group
awd_abstract_narration: Understanding the basis of gene expression is vital if researchers are to dissect the complex biology of living organisms.  The Bacillus cereus group represents a diverse collection of bacteria capable of living in a range of habitats and infecting a range of hosts.  Spontaneously occurring phenotypic variants are being isolated and characterized with a view to providing insights into how these organisms regulate gene expression.  A combination of traditional microbiological techniques coupled with DNA-based micro-array technology will be employed to uncover the basis of each variant providing fundamental data of value to researchers working in this area.
org_div_long_name: Division of Molecular and Cellular Biosciences
